page.title: 09BILLING AQUADROME (South).
page.content: At the height of the season,{half a {million people}pass through the main gate of the Aquadrome. What was originally farmland has now been turned into an area dedicated to water sports, caravaning and amusements. The Aquadrome owes its origin to the {Ice Age}which left sand and gravel in deep pockets across much of Eastern England. When the sand and gravel was later excavated the craters were filled with water, stocked with fish and the surrounding lips landscaped. Lines of{Willows}make an attractive backdrop to the 1200 static units. The marina has space for 200 boats. The season lasts from late March until late October and employs 200 people at its height. During week-ends and at holiday times locals enjoy the pleasant surrounds. During September over{1000 people enjoy the Fun Run.
